summary: RDXper is a web app that generates bar graphs and tables based on a research topic entered by the user
architectural_notes: Data visualization using bar graphs and tables
Research topic input as primary data source
Tech stack: vanilla JavaScript, CSS, and HTML (no frameworks)
Visual styling should emulate SPSS statistical software output

existing_features.title: Create a research topic input form on the frontend that allows users to enter a research topic as text
Create frontend components to render bar graphs from the generated data
Create frontend components to render tables from the generated data

Design a cohesive visual theme for RDXper with a professional, data-focused aesthetic using clean typography, a research-appropriate color palette (avoiding blue and purple), and structured layouts that emphasize data clarity and readability
Add a numeric input field to the research topic form that allows users to specify the number of figures/data points to generate (e.g., number of bars in graph, number of rows in table)
Update frontend data fetching hooks to pass the user-specified figure count to backend queries
Remove the Caffeine logo and any branding footer from the application UI

Update bar graph styling to match SPSS output aesthetics: use a clean, minimalist design with thin gridlines, standard gray axes, sans-serif labels, and muted default colors typical of statistical software output

Update table styling to match SPSS output aesthetics: use a simple grid layout with thin borders, monospace or sans-serif fonts for data cells, header row with subtle background, and precise alignment of numeric values

new_feature_requests.summary: Accept research topic input from user
Generate bar graphs from research topic
Implement backend logic to process research topic input and generate structured data suitable for bar graphs
Implement backend logic to process research topic input and generate structured tabular data
Allow user to specify the number of figures/data points to generate
Remove caffeine logo from the application footer
Update backend query functions to accept a figure count parameter and return the specified number of data points for both bar graph and table data
Style bar graphs and tables to match SPSS software output aesthetics
